Shanna Barnard | Skills

I build UI interfaces.
The core tools I use to do this are HTML, CSS and JavaScript.

html

  • I keep it accesible and semantic.
  • Follow UI/UX best practices and principles.

css

  • Follow architecture patterns.
  • Comfortable adopting the right preprocessor for the job.

javascript

  • Keep up with the latest developments but take a pragmatic approach to adopting tools and technology.
  • Currently using an OOP approach to develop with ES6.

Personally I'm not a fan reviewing a CV that lists every application someone has ever opened, I'm sure you can assume I know how to use an IDE and have managed to successfully moved a ticket along a swim-lane in JIRA so I will spare you the list.

Having worked in various sized organisations and teams and been exposed to and worked with countless methodologies, tools, libraries and frameworks that have evolved over the years. Listing these has very little value but rather the skills I believe make me a good developer are:

  • The ability to understand and apply new knowledge quickly.
  • Able to write code from scratch using solid arcitecture, principles and patterns.
  • Translate ideas effectively, as a result work out mutually agreeable solutions.
  • Ensure front end features are well covered by unit and integration tests.
  • Have an eye for detail (did you notice the typo in the third bullet point?)
  • Collegues like working with me, not only have I managed to strike a good balance in a code review but I believe I'm also able to bring good vibes to a team- don't bother with the previous point, there is no typo.
